fields.title: How to Become an Effective Programmer
fields.article:
This website only supports articles that are written using a markup langauge, called Markdown. This is an example markdown file, briefly introducing the language to familarize website owners with it.

Why Markdown is Used

At the end of the day, HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is what structures every website on the internet.

With respect to blogging, it would start to get tedious for bloggers (especially for non-programmers) if articles had to be written in HTML. Instead, it makes things way easier to store article entries using a lighter-weight human-friendly markup language. Argubaly, one of the best text formatters is of course Markdown.

What is Markdown

Markdown can be thought of as its own language, but that makes things sound more complicated than they really are.

Theres no need to take years of Markdown classes to become proficient in it, you just need to familiarize yourself with the formatting syntax that makes it tick. In fact, you can learn it within a few minutes, and of course, you can refer back to Markdown guides whenever you forget the syntax.

You will be grateful to Markdown by comparing how the two languages can be used to produce the same output.

In HTML:

<strong><i><a href="https://www.example.com">Example</a></i></strong>

In Markdown:

[**_Example_**](https://www.example.com)

Output for Both:

Example

Heres how Markdown works:

  • A writer or blogger like yourself inputs plain text using Markdown syntax.
  • The Markdown online editor converts the plain text into structurally correct HTML.

Let's Get Started

Lots of good Markdown guides can be easily searched on the internet. Here is one of them.

Writing in Markdown is way easier while using Markdown Live Preview.

You can convert them into HTML in this web application, which has also provided us with simple Markdown guides and even Live Preview!

To examplify a procedure,

  • Write a content using Markdown in Markdown Live Preview
  • Once finished, copy the content and paste it into the aforementioned web application.
  • See Raw HTML and copy all of the HTML
  • Paste it in Django Admin Interface

Sweet, that's it! After learning how to write in Markdown, you should be proud of yourself that you've successfully learnt a new "language".

Reference

Why Bloggers Should Use the Markdown Online Editor
